alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:44AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of northern Henderson, Rock Island, Mercer, southwestern Whiteside, northern Warren, western Henry, southwestern Jackson, Cedar, northeastern Benton, Delaware, Muscatine, Linn, northeastern Des Moines, central Louisa, Buchanan, Scott, southwestern Dubuque, northeastern Johnson, Jones and Clinton Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 543 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairbank to near Center Junction to near Davenport to near North Henderson. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, lightning and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Other locations in the path of these storms include New Windsor, Center Junction, Davenport, Eldridge, Long Grove, Rock Island, Alpha, Wyoming and Onslow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 254 and 306. Interstate 380 between mile markers 12 and 55. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 22. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
